title.narrative: OUTP 5.3: EDUCATION SYSTEM STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: Output 5.3: Strengthened political commitment, accountability and national capacity for evidence-based legislation, planning and budgeting for scaling-up quality and inclusive education., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 5: By 2020, all boys and girls, including young people, have increased and more equitable access to, and completion of, quality, inclusive education, with improved learning outcomes.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.3: Strengthened political commitment, accountability and national capacity for evidence-based legislation, planning andbudgeting for scaling-up quality and inclusive education.

description.narrative: The development of the School Financing and Early Learning policies was a key 2021 result, achieved with UNICEF’s technical support, now awaiting approval by Cabinet, as well as the development of the Inclusive Education Policy which is at the finalization stage. With UNICEF’s support, an inaugural, inclusive, highly participatory, virtual Joint Sector review was conducted, and the draft Education Sector Strategic Plan (2021-2025) was appraised with UNICEF’s technical contributions, which will guide the sector’s interventions for the next few years in support of quality education for children. ;The national curriculum reform process was successfully rolled out with UNICEF support. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
